about_the_game:
Moving Houses is a silly little physics-based game about moving on... or is it? Be neat, be careful, or be a chaos goblin. The choice is yours. But be warned, not all is as it seems in this quiet little house.

"It's time to leave my house," is something everyone says at some time in their life. Now it's your time, whether you want to leave or not. Enjoy this silly physics-based first-person game about moving on as you pack up your house, pack up your life while immersed in casual comfy gameplay and the instant gratification of task-based gamification of house based packing chores.

Expect to play around 3 hours for the main game, with another 3 hours for completionists to finish all the extra content.

Features
  • A fun physics-based first-person experience
  • Pickup household objects and try to pack them neatly into boxes
  • Give up, that's too much work
  • Just throw stuff around the house
  • Ok, get back to it
  • The satisfaction of checking items off a list
  • Laughter
  • Confusion
  • Crying
  • Horror
  • Wait, horror? Isn't this a cute casual game for the young at heart?
  • Sorry, you heard me, horror.
  • Oh. Can a kid play this?
  • Maybe. It gets kind of spooky. And weird. There's a little blood.
  • Whose blood?
  • ...
  • WHOSE BLOOD?
  • . . .

content_descriptors.notes: This game is not suitable for unsupervised children or those who are easily disturbed.  Contains some psychological horror that may be disturbing to some.

name: Moving Houses

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10+
  • Processor: Intel i5 2.5ghz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX11 or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Sound Card: Any modern
  • Additional Notes: Works nice on the Steam Deck!
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

reviews:
“I was shook... and I stayed shook till the credits rolled. And then I was shook some more. It kept getting weirder and weirder. Moving Houses is a legitimately great indie horror game.”
Dead Scene Media

“Moving Houses is the coziest nightmare we’ve ever played.”
Fearzine

“The game excels in creating an eerie atmosphere, especially with its visual design. The realistic items and charming environments lull you into a false sense of security, only for the house to slowly reveal its true, horrifying nature.”
Screen Hype
short_description: A silly little physics-based game about moving on... or is it? Be neat, be careful, or be a chaos goblin. The choice is yours. But be warned, not all is as it seems in this quiet little house.
supported_languages:
English*, Italian, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, French, German, Russian, Portuguese - Brazil
*languages with full audio support
